awd_titl_txt: Support for Student and Postdoc Participation in the 9th IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (IEEE CASE 2013)
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

por.por_cntn:
The objective of this conference participation
proposal is to offset the costs for 21 students and postdocs from U.S.
educational institutions to attend and/or present their research at the 9th
IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering  (IEEE CASE 2013)  held August 17-21, 2013,
in Madison, Wisconsin.The conference provides an international forum for
researchers to discuss innovation and the state of the art in the broad field
of automation systems, and to disseminate their recent advances and share their views in this area. The conference consisted of 4 days of technical
presentations and keynote speeches, as well as tours of the University of
Wisconsin-Madison’s manufacturing laboratories for research and teaching.
Publishing and participation in IEEE CASE 2013 was open to all members of the international automation research community.

Students and postdocs from U.S. institutions
attending conference have learned about the latest research progress
and challenges in automation systems, and presented papers they co-authored.
They had the opportunity to practice their communication skills and
network with researchers and engineers from the U.S. and around the world,
which will foster future collaborations and shape their future careers in, automation science and engineering. This conference experience is invaluable for
the highly talented group of students and postdocs who, as future automation
professionals and academics, will drive U.S. efforts to ensure its
competitiveness in automation.


Last Modified: 02/26/2014
Modified by: Leyuan Shi
